Name: Issue 359
Summary: MAUI Books, Learning Resources and .NET Conf Focus on MAUI Videos!
Introduction: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #359 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrap-up of the community articles around Xamarin and MAUI. Make sure to check out the recorded videos of .NET Conf MAUI sessions - so much good content that should keep you busy.  If not, Michael Stonis has released an Enterprise .NET MAUI Book and Gerald has compiled some learning resources for MAUI.   Don't forget, if you are looking for some sweet swag then jump on the NET MAUI Beautiful UI Challenge which is finishing soon! I know I won't be bored so until next time, take care. Kym

Articles.Title: Announcing the .NET MAUI Beautiful UI Challenge
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI community challenge featuring Snppts and Good Looking UI community run repos! Simply submit to be eligible for swag!

Articles.Title: Supporting Android v12+ Splash Screens in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Android recently changed how splash screens work in Android v12.0 (API Level 31). Let's take a look at how to support it in our Xamarin.Forms apps!

Articles.Title: .NET Conf Focus on MAUI - That's a wrap!
Articles.Description: .NET Conf: Focus on MAUI is a wrap!  The day was packed with sessions covering all topics of building beautiful multi-platform apps with .NET MAUI including designing UI, publishing apps, real-time apps, and so much more. In this post, Jeff covers some highlights from the event and give you all the information to get caught up on recordings and ongoing .NET MAUI activities that you can get involved with today.

Articles.Title: .NET Conf: Focus on MAUI recordings
Articles.Description: One-day livestream event that features speakers from the community and Microsoft teams working on and using .NET Multi-platform App UI. Learn how to build native apps for Android, iOS, macOS and Windows with a single codebase using .NET MAUI. Hear from the team building the .NET MAUI framework and tools in Visual Studio as well as experts from the community building .NET MAUI apps, libraries, components and controls.

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI - All you need to know about CollectionView
Articles.Description: In this video, Daniel Hindrikes talks about .NET MAUI and CollectionView.

Articles.Title: Barcode Scanner in .NET MAUI with ZXing.Net.Maui
Articles.Description: Barcodes or QR codes don't need any introduction. They are still everywhere and you are using barcode scanners in all of your apps. Have I got good news for you! With ZXing.Net.Maui you can now add a barcode scanner to your .NET MAUI app with ease, tune in to learn all about it.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Create a Shopping UI in .NET MAUI with SQLite
Articles.Description: In this webinar, we will create a shopping UI in .NET MAUI using SQLite. This shopping app will include several essential modules. We will focus on login design and product page design and implementation. On the product page, we will display the product name, description, photos, and pricing information. We keep the login information and product details in an SQLite database.
Articles.Author: Syncfusion

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI & Storage, Part 3 - Where to save application data
Articles.Description: In this video, Daniel will show you where to save/store application data depending on what type of data you want to save. Also make sure to check out the other parts in this video as well.
Articles.Author: Daniel Hindrikes

Articles.Title: A Better Pub/Sub Messenger for .NET Applications
Articles.Description: Sometimes you need to pass pieces of data to and from different parts of your application. This may be for communication between viewmodels or perhaps from your app startup class passing important information. With the .NET Community Toolkit you have a simple cross-platform way of sending and receiving messages no matter what type of app your are building. You can use it with .NET MAUI, WinUI, WPF, WinForms, ASP.NET Core, or just about any other .NET application!
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Using .NET MAUI Community Toolkit DrawingView
Articles.Description: Whether you are creating a Pictionary game or collecting signatures in your .NET MAUI app, the DrawingView will make your live much much easier! In this video we will learn what the .NET MAUI Community Toolkit DrawingView is, how to set it up and how to actually use it!
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis
